website_summaries.verdict: Small, affordable saw that is a fraction of the cost of the higher-end saws.
pros: Rated highly and perfect for the person on a tight budget
cons: Bolt tends to come loose too easily

customer_reviews.title: Day one. The bolt broke off right away.
customer_reviews.text: just the first day I was working with the item it broke right away. it was the bolt that is holding blade. I saw the same issue and photo from amazon.com review but i thought it wouldnt be my story.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on 6-9-16 and used it for the first time on 7-01-16. I was cutting 5/8" cdx plywood when the bolt that secures the blade to the saw snapped off. BROKE OFF. The bolt head shot backwards and blade wobbled around as I disengaged the trigger. I was extremely luck not to injured in any capacity. I was fooled by the hype of the commercial and the rugged sounding narrator as the actor cut pieces of 2x4's. Don't buy this product as it clearly has some manufacturer safety issues. Sure I may have gotten the 1 out of 30 that's defective, but it is not good odds when your safety is in jeopardy.
customer_reviews.author: dennis beath

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the hubby for Christmas. It is just now warm enough to go outside and start working on projects around the house. It got turned on, and the screw that holds the blade on snapped in half, but because it's been longer than 30 days, we get to eat the cost of a new saw. Very, very upset at both the crappy product and the crappy return policy.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBronco

customer_reviews.title: the locking screw had sheared off and the saw became totally useless. The job was finished after setting up my ...
customer_reviews.text: The saw arrived quickly (thanks Amazon) and appeared to be very well made. It also arrived just in time to get started on a deck project and making quick work of trimming about 50 - 5/4" x 1" pressure treated deck boards. Around 6 to 7 boards into the project, the blade came loose (after making sure the locking screw was set) and the blade came rolling out. Whoops, the locking screw had sheared off and the saw became totally useless. The job was finished after setting up my Makita sliding chop saw and deft use of a hand saw... I lost valuable time and the Rockwell is being returned for a refund. I'm steering clear of Rockwell products.
customer_reviews.author: Gee-oh

customer_reviews.title: I liked this for simple
customer_reviews.text: Currently waiting on my refund. I liked this for simple, small cuts. But going into my second small project the nut that holds the blade on snapped in half and the blade shot out into the piece of wood I was cutting. It was not hard wood. It was a pretty soft piece of pine from a pallet, I had removed all nails from the wood. I've read that this has happened with multiple people so I think it's a product quality issue. Either way, as much as I liked the saw, I wouldn't buy another based on the fact I don't feel very safe using it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: I just took it out f the box and installed blade with arbor on to the unit I started to cut plywood when the arbor sheered off and blade fell out in 10 seconds of use sending it back to amazon asap beware
customer_reviews.author: vinnyisnice

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used this saw for the first time this weekend to cut some MDF / particle board. The saw worked great till one of the final of about 12 cuts. The cut were less than 3' each time. The final cut the blade stopped and the BLADE BOLT snapped. I contacted ROCKWELL as it was past Amazon's return policy by 2 weeks. ROCKWELL is willing to replace my NEW saw with a SLIGHTLY USED unit and charge me to ship it. Needless to say I am unhappy with this situation for multiple reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Better with a shop-made handle in front.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small saw that drops into a tool bag and has good dust control. This fits the bill. I felt that this saw as it came had ergonomic issues so bad it's a safety issue. Real lack of control trying to drive that saw from behind, kept wanting to grab it in front near the blade. After I made a handle from a nicely shaped scrap and attached it to the included guide I was the happy camper, and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Ibsen Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty weak
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I was so excited to get this saw since my Hyper Tough from Walmart stripped a gear. Pros: It turns on Cons: It struggles to cut 1/2" plywood. What saw struggles to cut that? The blade that comes with it is so thin and flimsy that it gets hot and with the guide on it pulls off track and binds the saw. The Hyper Tough is rated 5.8 amps but seems to be twice as strong as this one. I am very disappointed in this saw, what a let down. The picture shows what I am talking about. The edge guide never left the edge of the plywood. Decide for yourself but I'd move on.
customer_reviews.author: MCAJ bvdse

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My experience with this saw RK3441K went from pretty darn good to extreme disappointment in just days beyond the 3-year manufacturer’s warranty. Despite its foibles it was a useful tool for my needs. That is, until it died with absolutely no more than a total of about 3-4 actual hours of run time (if that!). It lasted exactly the three years of warranty. An unreliable tool is simply garbage and that’s the bottom line.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bright

customer_reviews.title: Don't put in risk your life don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I will let you know, is this is a piece of crap don't buy this. I almost killed myself because the blade Falls Apart, and right now I don't know even how fix it. I already bought the replacement is screw but it's impossible to replace it. I never would buy anything for this company again. The funny thing this was the first time technically I use that because I bother around like 1 year and a half for a small project but I never use it and I never return it my bad.
customer_reviews.author: Palomio

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and a PITA to use.
customer_reviews.text: Im a professional contractor. I have been kind of disappointed in this little saw simply because it COULD BE SO MUCH BETTER! The ergonomics are horrible because of the huge grip and awkwardly placed "safety" switch. You can't get close enough to a wall when doing inside corner cuts despite the advantage of the small blade diameter. The vacuum hook up is some homeowner nooozle size and the blades that come with it are garbage. I paid $80 for this thing... I would have rather spent $150-$200 on a professional grade version.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell RK3441K Compact Circular Saw Kit
customer_reviews.text: A great, light weight alternative to a full size (7 1/4" or larger) circular saw. It seems to be sensitive to having the depth of cut adjusted properly, i.e. no more blade exposed than absolutely necessary otherwise the blade binds. Care must also be taken when cutting dimensional stock (1x, 2x4, etc...) as the saw will kick. This is dangerous on a saw designed to be held with only one hand. That said, I still reach for this saw first before a larger circular saw.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell Compact Saw
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I found so far is the safety button on the left side of the handle. For me, it's a problem , because I am left handed and it just about impossible to hold in on the safety switch and try to use the saw being left handed. It can be don e but with difficulty.....The saw does run nice but being left handed can be a problem..If the unit was made for either right or left handed users it would solve the problem... l guess l could use the saw right handed but I don't think I can control the cut as good...being left handed....
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic concern and heavier than i expected while holding with my right hand
customer_reviews.text: I like the price and delivery, but dislike the Ergonomic issue of not holding with two hands, with right hand on the handle and the left hand unable to hold the front of the saw when cutting a piece of wood. I was going to return this saw but the return window closed on August 17, 2019 which is one month after purchasing this product. Not happy :(
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wing

customer_reviews.title: It definitely serves a purpose for quick cuts that you ...
customer_reviews.text: It definitely serves a purpose for quick cuts that you don't want to drag out the skil saw for. The positive aspect I was looking forward to is the blade mounted on the left side of the motor / drive. This should allow for a more precision cut when you can see your line the whole time. Unfortunately, the negative thing I noted is that with mine at least, when you attempt to drive the blade down the line, it seems to bind a little. I suspect the blade and the guide notch aren't precisely aligned, but I can't determine if or how it can be adjusted. Overall, for a light, quick saw to lop stuff off with, it Rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry R. Debacker

customer_reviews.title: Quality circle saw at a solid price
customer_reviews.text: Great well-made tool. I've only used this saw a couple of times and have to say it seems very well made, comparable to tools twice the price. Can't speak to durability just yet but I guess time will tell. The blade it comes with is super sharp. So far I've cut used it to cut both wood and PVC and it has performed admirably at both. As with any handheld saw, practice common sense as far as safety is concerned and wear eye protection! This is a pretty powerful saw, significantly more so than a battery powered saw - it will "jump" towards you when you touch the blade to whatever you're cutting, use a firm grip!
customer_reviews.author: A Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Safety Button needs help in design
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw to work along with my Worx 4.5" saw used for Laminate Flooring. Both saws are made by the same manufacture, but the Rockwell has much more power and is sturdier on the base. The saw is extremely heavy compared to the Worx unit and the Trigger Safety Button is Impossible for a small handed person to operate. I use the opposite hand to press button when turning on saw away from work. The Grip is also Very Uncomfortable compared to the Worx saw. Not my favorite, but plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for small jobs requiring fine control.
customer_reviews.text: This 4-1/2 inch Rockwell circular saw is as heavy as I can comfortably hold for a vertical 57" cut on each side of the refrigerator opening in my Argosy trailer. The guide that comes with it enabled me to make cabinet grade cuts on exactly 7/16" wider than the existing opening. The cut had to be accurate and clean. Also used this saw to shorten 4 legs on a piano bench for my wife...it made the job easy. This is a great saw for small jobs requiring precise control.....couldn't have done the job without it. I am pleased with this addition to my home shop.
customer_reviews.author: Hi Desert Richard

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to Maneuver Saw
customer_reviews.text: Rockwell saw arrived on time, in new condition and in factory box; came complete with all paperwork, manual instr., straight guide, hex key, saw blade. When first used saw (out of the box) to cut some interior doors in half, the cheap factory saw blade did bind up numerous times. I purchased a quality (4 1/2" size) carbide tipped saw blade and this blade went easily through new 2 x 4 s.
customer_reviews.author: PNTHSE9900

customer_reviews.title: Good for Unique Projects
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for certain unique projects. I bought this specifically to cut out 1"x1" rectangular pieces out of 4x4s, and it works exactly how I hoped it would. The depth of cut is adjustable down to 2" according to the product specs, but I would say its actually just short of 2". I have used it for 1.75" deep cuts with no problem. There is also a nice adjustable edge guide that can be adjusted and held on the side of the board to get a straight line cut. The saw can also adjust to make angled cuts, though I haven't used that feature yet. Overall this is a great saw if you use it for the right application!
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent saw.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent saw. This saw has the power and for all the tricky cutting I need to do. I wish I bought this 10 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Castle12

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful saw will handle most of your sawing needs
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this saw to use for cutting sheathing when working on my garage roof. I thought it would be a good compact alternative to carrying a full-sized circular saw up and down the ladder. The power of this saw impressed me, it easily cuts through 2" x 4" lumber and powers through a 4' x 8" sheet of 5/8" plywood with no problem! Having finished re-roofing my garage, I find myself reaching for this lightweight saw for most of my sawing needs. My full-sized circular saw is still necessary for cutting dense or thicker pieces of lumber but I find the Rockwell compact saw can handle at least 75% of my sawing needs.
customer_reviews.author: GMakTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!  Very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic! It definitely feels durable and makes strong, straight cuts. I feel like it performs as good as a regular 7-inch circular saw. I normally use this one over the 7-inch one. It fits perfect in my hands, easy to maneuver. I originally purchased this because I was a little nervous to use the bigger circular saw as I just got into wood working, building stuff. This was super easy to use and helped ease my fears. I now can use the bigger one, but this one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Either defective or useless.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install flooring. Purchased additional blades, all set to go, sadly the saw could not handle load. Disappointed as unit failed to work cutting any thickness 3/4, 1/2, or 3/8 without coming to a stop. Most likely a bad unit will return.
customer_reviews.author: cgstatenj

customer_reviews.title: I bought this tool thinking it would be better than my 7-1/4" in some respects but I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool thinking it would be better than my 7-1/4" in some respects but I was wrong. It isn't going to be your "go-to" tool in a pinch. If you don't have a good 7-1/4 saw, then yes it will be usefull but this thing is woefully under powered by comparison. I think they came up with these types of saws for the easily intidated craftsman, small blade, small handle etc. Bottom line: if you have a decent 7-1/4" saw, save your mony and steer clear of this type of tool.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: loved; quiet, powerfull for his size clean cut no too much dust like my old saw. my issues is i'm left handle, need to learn how to use with my right hand. in overall is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Feliciano papo

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for numerous projects cutting treated lumber, plywood and various pvc pipes, etc.. Using the right blade for the job is crucial and I have been totally impressed with this saw. Have had no problems whatsoever. I am surprised by all the negative reviews. I love this saw and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Wynne E. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an elderly small left-handed woman and I love this easy to use saw. I cut some particle board shelving and it was a breeze. It's just the right weight for me and fits in my hand. You don't have to keep the safety button down while sawing - it click-locks down and then you can start the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Indie T

customer_reviews.title: Probably OK for remodeling projects
customer_reviews.text: Probably OK for remodeling projects, but not for fine wood working trim. My intent when making this purchase was to have a saw for squaring ends of hardwood glued panels that are too long for my table saw. Very disappointed with the results. The saw labored cutting 3/4" white oak. Probably because of the poor quality blade. My dilemma is: (1) rid myself of a useless tool or (2) spent $$$ on better blade ( hoping for better results).
customer_reviews.author: One Pony Show

customer_reviews.title: CUTS LIKE A KNIFE; FEELS SO RIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: A little LION that ROARS and cuts most-excellent. This little thing is addictive; you won't want to pull out your heavy 7 1/4 saw after a few swipes with this handy item.
customer_reviews.author: CFL

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw to have around, don't abuse it though.
customer_reviews.text: A very useful compact saw. It's not the highest quality tool I own, but If you take care of it I see no reason why it wouldn't last, but it definitely can't be abused. It cuts 2x4/6 very easily and since its small it's very easy to make accurate cuts. The safety button is sometimes a hassle to push in before pulling the trigger and limits the angles at which I have been able to effectively use the saw, but nonetheless it's a nice little saw to have around, and Rockwells customer service is top notch, and they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this saw and was not happy with the quality at all
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saw and was not happy with the quality at all. The base plate could not be set to lay 90 degrees from the blade. the tool cuts fine otherwise. took some grinding on the base stop to get it the 90 degree position. Try another saw before looking at this tool or buy in a store and check it out first. That's the risk we take when buying things online.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!! What a saw!
customer_reviews.text: This is a small compact circular saw that is just as powerful and more useful than a standard circular saw. Easy to store and easy to use. Came very professionally packed in a Rockwell box. Easy to adjust the settings and switch out the blade if necessary. The fact that it will cut a 2 x 4 is what attracted me the most to this saw. Most compact circular saws will not cut through a 2 x 4 with one cut. Excellent saw at an unbeatable price. Made very well and can be used for so many projects. Comes with 1 blade but bought another one specifically for plywood that also works great. So glad I made this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: loucrew

customer_reviews.title: simply awesome - Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This little tool is AWESOME. First, it is lightweight. The included blade is sharp and has a very thin kerf. This makes cutting with it easily The fence is perfectly parallel to the blade and that makes using this with a saw guide great. My other old circular saw is crooked Because of the construction, of the saw, the blade can be tilted the opposite way of most circular saws. This makes it great when those angled cuts can't be done any other way. But, for me, the best thing is the vacuum port. That thing really does an absolutely​ awesome job of cutting down on dust on the job site.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S. Winters

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman with an average size hand and because of the positioning of the safety start button it's extremely difficult to start the saw. I can barely reach both the safety button and the start switch. Every start is difficult, which means I'm not starting off smoothly for cutting. I've also had a problem with the blade not turning and I'm not sure if this is because I'm not strong enough to tighten it really hard or if it's a flaw with this tool. In any event, I had such high hopes that I had found a saw that would be easy for me to use, but I've been really disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: KSR

customer_reviews.title: Great saw once you get used to the grip
customer_reviews.text: I am a female with medium sized hands. At first I had some difficulty getting comfortable with the way one has to grip the saw in order to hold the safety button while pulling the trigger. Once I found a comfortable way to do this I found the saw very easy to control. So far I have used the saw to easily cut laminate flooring, rip sheets of plywood and cut 2 x 4 lumber. Because it is easier to handle than my skill saw, my cuts are much more precise.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cipolla

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: I had change review since I used it over half years. 1,The issues is the back plastic handle to lock the saw is too soft to locked and you do not know..........then the saw blade cutted more......!!!!! It made me crazy for several times!!!! So I change my review and give 3*. 2, the button to start the saw is hard to handle and hold!
customer_reviews.author: Sanger

customer_reviews.title: great tool for arthritis sufferers!
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love this tool! i am getting older and suffer arthritis, so standard power saws are getting to be difficult for me to use. this one is just as strong as the regular sized circular saw units but much easier to use. you can cut plywood and 2 x 4s with ease. this is a review for a personal purchase i paid full price for. This was a personal purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G. Samson

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little piece of machinery! It's well made, powerful, and makes precision cuts. I don't even bother with my old, standard size circular saw anymore. And the vacuum attachment works great - very little dust escapes, so I'm able to use it indoors without coating a room with a dusty film.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: Besides cutting wood and metal it has a sanding attachment to get into corners.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for those tight spaces. Just finished installing modular closet systems in the master and second bedrooms. This tool made quick work of removing baseboards.
customer_reviews.author: jwc

customer_reviews.title: Handy saw
customer_reviews.text: Been doing some remodeling and bought this on a whim, I love it. Easy to use. Powerful if you dont push it. Trigger is a little tricky getting used to. I would not replace my full size circular saw, but this is nice for trim and light work.
customer_reviews.author: tim smith

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This tool is hard to reach the safety button and trigger at the same time which is how it runs. Both simultaneously need to be done in order to start cutting. It's also a very heavy tool to hold with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: solid product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product as a first time owner of a circular saw. I'm working through a DIY bathroom build. This cuts all the 2 x 4's in ribs 8 foot sheets of three-quarter inch OSB and half-inch sheets of plywood very well. Easy to complete one handed. No complaints about the thumb in trigger positioning as other users have mentioned. Many cards completed on my first blade and have also hit one screw had on accident. Blade still performing very well.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelÃÂ KevinÃÂ McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Very handy light-weight easy to maneuver saw
customer_reviews.text: Very handy light-weight easy to maneuver saw. Powers through 3/4" plywood, OSB and 2x material with nary a struggle. The downside is that it has a dual trigger system that is nearly impossible to actuate one handed and extremely awkward to actuate with two hands. Either way the initial start-up is quite dangerous. If using just one hand, one has to compromise a sturdy, safe grip to reach both triggers. Using two hands offers a whole other challenge since two hands on the handle means there is nothing holding the work piece stable at the beginning of the cut. Clamps or a clamping system are a must to maintain safety.
customer_reviews.author: debtfreemt

customer_reviews.title: Blade falling out a frequent problem I guess!
customer_reviews.text: Like the first four or five one star reviewers the bolt holding the blade snapped off while I was sawing a thin plywood panel today. I had the saw for more than a year but it had only infrequent use. Rockwell should do a recall or at least repair broken saws for free or better yet Amazon should stop selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ruane

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose saw.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw just to cut out a hole in a quartz countertop for a sink install. I bought a special 60 tooth blade and utilized the vacuum connection on the saw. It worked better than I expected. It operated very smoothly, didn’t overheat, buck, or jam.
customer_reviews.author: Be Happy

customer_reviews.title: Fast accurate cuts with great dust pickup
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this tool, but pleasantly surprised. The dust pickup with use of shop vac is excellent. I swapped blade for diablo and it is amazing on cabinet plywood and veneer. Great blade view for accurate cuts, especially when using vac. My only complaint is the safety button/trigger placement are not particularly ergonomic. I have to reposition my hand after starting to get a comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: wow, much easier to use than my skill saw. lighter and better view of the line your trying to cut on
customer_reviews.text: wow, much easier to use than my skill saw. lighter and better view of the line your trying to cut on. the safety button on this saw is no problem what so ever to push in with your thumb. i read some review indicated a problem, buy I think they were reviewing the smaller saw of another brand. Thanks, Rockwell for this great product
customer_reviews.author: spicewoodtx

customer_reviews.title: but pretty easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't cut through a true 4 inch piece of wood, but pretty easy to move around, you just need to make sure you're using the correct blade for the material you're cutting through
customer_reviews.author: Cory Savino

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: A bit on the heavy and bulky side for me but it's an excellent saw. I keep it on my boat to do remodel and repairs. I recommend purchasing two other blades for different jobs
customer_reviews.author: school of art

customer_reviews.title: Nice little circular saw
customer_reviews.text: Was able to get this saw in time for a complete fence building project at home. All the big box stores had no inventory for weeks. Does a great job for 2" x 4" lumber but nothing much larger. Keep that in mind. I would have given it 5 stars except for one annoying feature. It has a safety button on the left side that must be manually pushed before cutting. I'm sure this is some mandated rule out there but it's still a hassle. Cross or rip cuts were done very well.
customer_reviews.author: ezrbc

customer_reviews.title: The movable parts of the saw seem a little flimsy and don't fit that well but the basic motor and blade mechanism work fine.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small trim saw for tight situations and this fills the need most of the time. The movable parts of the saw seem a little flimsy and don't fit that well but the basic motor and blade mechanism work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Really liking it
customer_reviews.text: Really liking this little saw. It goes through a 2x4 like butter, but can also rip a piece of plywood. It is powerful, but light. The grip is a little less ergonomic than I would like, but it is good enough for my medium sized hands. It might be uncomfortable for someone with small hands (not sure). This is my goto saw for home projects. It does seem to have good build quality and material. It is not at all whimpy and seems able to compete decently with the higher end brands.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lee

customer_reviews.title: A good saw if your expectations are reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: It struggles to crosscut 2x4 material, forget about trying to rip a 2x4. Great for foam board and material less than 1” thick. Guide bar works well and the Allen wrench holder in the cord is very convenient. Depth and angle adjustments are easy to make. Overall, for the price, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: VVV

customer_reviews.title: The Sports Car of Circular Saws
customer_reviews.text: After almost 40 years of using the same heavy/bulky 7 1/2" Skill Saw, this semi retired contractor had a mid life crisis and bought this zippy little tool for light projects around the house. Quick and responsive I have easily cut thru 2x4 pressure treated studs like, well a stud! I find with this Rockwell product, slowing down a tad to adapt to the smaller size keeps the frustration of impatience a bay. Overall, for the DIY kinda guy/gal this is a really nice, quality saw for your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: KuKu

customer_reviews.title: Good electric saw, worst blade
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty steady, powerful, and maneuverable. However, be ready to change the blade immediately. It will not stand more than 4 cuts of 6 inches long each one. The manufacturer should take that into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Riera Seivane

customer_reviews.title: What a jewel for my shop!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is a jewel!! Very well made, great balance and very effective at accurate and easy cuts. I am removing and installing 16 windows in our house, this saw can be set to plunge cut the siding to reveal the nail strip. With one hand! A huge time saver! I have used it to easily cut 2x4s for saw horses and plywood several times now. No more dragging out the big saws, just grab it from the tool drawer, plug it in, and go. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw. The lines are perfectly cut and so easy to use. I recommend this is everyone's tool collection.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for DIY'rs
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite toy! It is so much easier and versatile than the standard circular saw. I've used it for cutting plywood and pine boards to make cabinets and built in shelving. Was able to cut into a 2" x 8" while it was still attached to the wall. One thing I don't like is the location of the safety lock button, you need two hands to unlock the safety while holding the saw in place, and the other thing is the dust discharge. It would be really nice if they included a dust bag instead of the useless adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Mixdplate

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: Have both the old Dremel and this saw, this is a major improvement! Have used it to cut 3/4 inch plywood, 2x4's, shelving and it rips through it all without a hitch. The old Dremel would bind and heat up to the point it was unusable. Now the new Dremels have a more powerful motor, but cost significantly more than the Rockwell. For the price point, this is a great saw and very easy to use as an alternative to the larger, but more cumbersome, circular saws.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: It works well, but it should include a case for this price.
customer_reviews.text: I think it works well but it needs some type of case. I did some research on compact circular saws and Rockwell seems to be a top brand. Other brands offer extra blades or a case along with a lower price, but it's hard to say if the quality is established. This was a safe purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good power, control and surprisingly fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: Saw works great and its very convenient. It was actually fun to use. Have done cuts on 3/4" material that was in hard to reach areas. Good power and control. One cosmetic negative is that the logo "Rockwell" painted in white on the side body of the saw smudges. The paint is sticky (very strange). Rubbed some alcohol to remove the bad paint and its ok now. Local store units I looked at don't have this issue, but the price was higher. I ordered a spare saw blade online since local stores selection for this size are really poor.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great depth of cut
customer_reviews.text: Most of these small saws only cut less than one inch at .90 This little devil cuts a full 2 inches. I cut up a bunch of waste 2x4 into small pieces that are easy to dispose of making it easy to clean up my work area.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Parisette

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to be a good buy, but since I bought it, I’ve never been able to use it. It smokes a lot. I’ve purchased new blades and nothing seems to work. It’s dead set in just being garbage. Worst purchase yet.
customer_reviews.author: SAHD

customer_reviews.title: This saw is better than my porter cable trim saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw is better than my porter cable trim saw. Should have come with a hard case and I would have scored it five stars. Bought four different blades for other usages and love how it's small, portable and easy to use. "Stop" button came off after changes blades over a period of two weeks...., a little soon. In the big picture of things.......This saw is perfect for immediate cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald P. Schyvynck

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for Xmas and just took it out of the box to use yesterday. This is so easy to use. I had to go to you tube to put it together. For a woman it’s a dream to use!
customer_reviews.author: sandee985

customer_reviews.title: Best to use with two hands as in some material ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut some drywall from the ceiling against the rafters. A drywall knife just wasn't working with the texturing on the ceiling - I just couldn't cut it. I set the depth on this tool and cut away. Down in about 2 minutes. I've used it to rip beadboard and 2x4 and it hasn't hickuped...rips right through them. Best to use with two hands as in some material I got kickback. Easy goto tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for small female hands
customer_reviews.text: This is a great circular saw. It is easier to use than the regular sized one. The adapter for the saw dust vac that came with the Rockwell did not fit our dry vac hose. We used a hose that fit the adapter and used duct tape to connect that hose and the hose of our dry vac and it worked. The reason for the 4-stars and not 5 is that as a female, my hands are not big enough to hold the red safety button and the start button. I have to use both hands. I would highly recommend this circular saw.
customer_reviews.author: disbemsdeb

customer_reviews.title: Just Awesome! Tool feels solid made my Project easy
customer_reviews.text: Just Awesome! Tool feels solid made my Project easy! I was using porter cable circular saw before cutting 4x8 3/4" in half was heavy this weekend I needed to cut 4x8 1" thick for a counter top and it handled great reaching over not a problem I am not a tall Guy cuts smooth with lots of power. I recommend this product to anyone looking for portability. Rockwell should kick me in some blades for this review!!
customer_reviews.author: Pescador

customer_reviews.title: You Need This!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool! Light, Compact, Extremely powerful, extremely useful! I was hot stuff at work when I showed up weilding this beautiful work of art. No more straining to hold up that heavy piece of junk they call a saw. This gets the job done at a lower price, while also being so much better. You need this saw!
customer_reviews.author: Firepet

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift? My husband really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Culvey

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  I look for projects to use this compact saw.
customer_reviews.text: My only regret.. I wish I had bought this sooner! Comes in usefull for many projects (where a circular saw is slightly too big for the task). Handle ergonomics is good. No complaints yet, will update
customer_reviews.author: BP_75_WhiteSox

customer_reviews.title: Small, powerful, and easy to work with. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I was debating to get either Rockwell RK3441K Compact Circular Saw or Rockwell RX3440K VersaCut Circular Saw. I finally settle with this RK3441K Compact Circular Saw. Mainly I am able to cut 2-inch wood with RK3441K in one cut. The RK3440K won't be able to cut 2-inch wood in one run. Comparing with the 7.5 inch circular saw, this RK3441 is easier to maneuver around. Especially, it is easy to use in tight space. I highly recommend this versatile saw.
customer_reviews.author: H. Wang

customer_reviews.title: High quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Worked well to me (XL size). But grip was too big. You need to have a King Kong size hand to hold the tool, and feel comfortable and safe.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nichipor

customer_reviews.title: Nice little saw
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint so far with this tool is the ability to hold down the safety button and hit the trigger so the saw will start...thats tough to do with one hand. I know its necessary but it isnt easy to do...I found myself continually trying to adjust my hand during start/stops. The saw itself is a great little tool. I do not regret this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawks

customer_reviews.title: Hard to hold.
customer_reviews.text: It takes holding two switches, a bottom mounted trigger and a side mounted safety switch, to get this saw moving. Even my large hands have difficulty holding both while attempting to steer and control the saw. An additional control knob above and in front of the blade like on many larger saws would be a plus in controlling cuts. Twice it got away from me while cutting half inch Dura Ply. I don't like it.
customer_reviews.author: SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, Small Saw
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I bought it because I was building a replacement fence and needed to cut pieces for the gate. Very powerful, and perfect for cutting wood that is not too thick. This one also adjust to cut at angles, which can be valuable for different projects.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: DIFFICULT TO OPERATE FOR USERS WITH SMALL HANDS
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE TO USE TWO HANDS TO OPERATE! I NEED TO PUSH THE TRIGGER LOCK BUTTON WITH ONE HAND WHILE ACTIVATING THE TRIGGER WITH THE OTHER HAND.
customer_reviews.author: CLIVE FRANCIS

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, easy to handle and cuts great
customer_reviews.text: Nice saw, easy to handle and cuts great. Mine arrived with the rivet missing from one end of the pivoting sole plate but rather than return it I just put in a small nut and bolt with some thread lock to keep it together without having to tighten it down too much. The only other complaint that others have also addressed is the thumb switch which is a bit difficult to reach and if you are wearing gloves it is impossible without using your free hand. All that being said I still find myself reaching for this one in favor of my full size circular saw for most jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: Will be my "go to" saw
customer_reviews.text: Very nice saw. I was trying to use a full size circular saw to cut out some bad sections of lap-n-gap cedar. Vertical cuts at 45 deg angle were very awkward and with the large blade I had to cut into adjacent boards more than I wanted. This little saw did the trick. Only negative is the somewhat awkward safety button but I finally developed a technique to maneuver the saw, hold the blade guard out of the way so I could make a plunge cut, hold the safety button down and pull the trigger.
customer_reviews.author: bgibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw!
customer_reviews.text: A very handy circular saw that does a great job of anything in its size range (1-5/8" depth). I used it extensively for two weeks on two major products and am very pleased with the performance. My only complaint is that the trigger safety interlock button is all but inaccessible if you also need a hand to hold the blade guard open to do a plunge cut. But I guess OSHA wants to make bypassing the safety measures difficult! Some of my other more recent power tools share similar difficulties.
customer_reviews.author: Gary RV_Wizard

customer_reviews.title: I never used a small saw like this before
customer_reviews.text: I never used a small saw like this before; always had the 7 1/2" heavy circular saw. This is really easy to use. The vac attachment works great and cuts out nearly all dust. Very light and easy to just pull out and use for a quick cut. Has really good power for such a small motor.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Larry

customer_reviews.title: Cuts subfloor, 2x6s, drywall, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saw to cut up my subfloor and to cut drywall and it works great. The only reason I give it 4 and not 5 is that the saw does stop mid cut, but you just have to slow down and make sure it's running full RPM through your cut. When hooked up to my vacuum it's really loud, but overall it's a good buy for the price and blades are easily available.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for all around cutting when you don't want to lug out the big one.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent worm drive saw. A bit beefier than I thought it would be but that's a good thing since it's good for professional work. I bought one of the Amazon warehouse Deals that was a return. I found the saw blade was installed backward and it shows wear from attempting to cut something. The Writing goes on the outside! I doubt that it works well this way so I put the blade on the correct way and it cuts great! I wonder how many other tools that guy returned because he couldn't get them to work properly....
customer_reviews.author: Dean G.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like good saw but fence was not square
customer_reviews.text: This saw looks good and lots of parts were metal and fairly sturdy....only problem was the fence you use to rip boards was not square so it was impossible to cut them straight. We could not bend it square because it was welded unsquare. Something as simple as a fence not being made right and it being a gift, i was not going to give it to my husband. I returned it and will go to a brick and mortar store to buy tools next time so we can inspect and be sure all is made well.
customer_reviews.author: Domestic_Diva23

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. Like having a full sized table saw in the palm of your hand.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times since purchase and am very pleased. The photos don't do this item justice. This thing is like literally having an actual table saw in your hand. This isn't some small, cheaply made portable toy saw. This saw is heavy and very sturdy in your hands. I'm not a pro and my name isn't Bob Villa so I can't speak to every thing you could possibly do with a saw like this but for my small jobs it has been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I put together a Chicken Pen and pulled the saw out to make a small cut and ended up using it for the whole project. It is powerful, cuts straight and very light. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Bell

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous and cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Bolt that holds the blade in place broke after 5 minutes of use on thin plywood. Parts went flying everywhere. Such a huge waste of money, not to mention extremely dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Simple and light. Kind of hard to operate being ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple and light. Kind of hard to operate being left handed, as it requires you to press the red button at the same time you press the power. Also hard to operate if you have Trump hands and not a firm grip on the machine.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Rockwell Compact Circular Saw Beats the Cheaper Saws Sold on TV.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-built, solid compact saw. You will pay more for the Rockwell but won't regret it. Especially useful is the ability to attach a vacuum hose to remove most of the dust created when cutting wood. The vacuum hose attachment accommodates most hoses from ShopVac machines. Blade will cut deep enough for 2x4s, wood sheeting, and wood or plastic molding. Avoid purchasing the cheaper compact circular saws that are sold on TV. Read the online reviews first for these cheaper products and you will see why you should pay more for a Rockwell brand!
customer_reviews.author: R. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Great power in a small form factor
customer_reviews.text: Great power in a small form factor. Blade if close to out side of shoe which is a plus in many use cases where a standard 71/4 saw can't be used. The only issue I have with the saw is the trigger and safety are not well configured. The safety button is in an unnatural position regardless of using the saw in the left or right hand. Dust extraction port works well however the adapter supplied can detach during use, a more positive attachment would be helpful when using the tool attached to a vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Dick

customer_reviews.title: This is a good tool but do not think you can use this ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tool but do not think you can use this all day long on thick wood, yes it will cut a 2x4, 2x6 but you don't want to cut 100 2x4's at a time. I used it to cut dog ear fence boards about 200 and it worked great. Good for light weight projects.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Arra

customer_reviews.title: Very compact & seems like it will b easy 2 use
customer_reviews.text: My husband really wanted this item for Christmas & he really likes it. He hasn't used it yet but he said it will really help him this summer.
customer_reviews.author: AmyLeVan

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Great little saw. Rips right through 3/4 inch ply, leaves a nice finish (with included blade, and easy to handle. I've always had trouble with my full sized circle saw especially on smaller projects. The ergonomic design allows much more control especially on vertical surfaces and with smaller pieces. Clamp on a straight edge cutting guide and you're good to go
customer_reviews.author: danimal

customer_reviews.title: I can't cut a straight line ...
customer_reviews.text: A disappointment ... I can't cut a straight line on a 12 mm board, I bought the saw a few months ago and had it stored ... I just took it out to do a job and the surprise ... I couldn't cut more than 5 cm ... and then it deviates
customer_reviews.author: Israel cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Easy one hand operation.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to use with one hand. Just have to remember where the other hand is. Works great and wish I had purchased one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McAdams

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: I love this little saw. I have cut plywood two-by-fours and all kinds of other dimensional lumber and have not had any type of issues it cut straight and it's got plenty of power
customer_reviews.author: JAva

customer_reviews.title: A+++ Tool to have around!
customer_reviews.text: This saw is great. It cuts 2x4's with ease. Wish I had bought it before I replaced my deck floor. Glad it arrived in time for building the porch rails. It is light weight and so easy to use. Even with arthritis in my right hand, I can hold it safely and make accurate cuts.I highly recommend this to hobbyist and professionals. A++++ tool to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K.

customer_reviews.title: but I like it and have used it on other jobs since
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a one time repair job, but I like it and have used it on other jobs since. I had the task to cut the bottom 1/2" off the existing OSB sheathing under the vinyl siding on the peripheral of a house to seal up air leaks. This saw is light and easy to handle in the awkward position of laying on your side while scooching along the ground cutting the bottom off the sheathing. It worked perfectly and cut hours off the job.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Clark

product_meta.title: Rockwell RK3441K 4-1/2” Compact Circular Saw, 5 amps, 3500 rpm with Dust Port and Accessory Kit
product_meta.description: Style:Circular sawThe Rockwell Compact 4-1/2-inch Circular Saw (RK3441K) is a powerful and functional circular saw which can replace conventional 7-1/4-inch circular saws. No need for a bulky circular saw when the Compact Circular Saw will cut 2x4s and sheet goods in the same amount of time with ease and comfort, thanks to its lightweight and compact design. You’ll finish your jobs quicker without having to drag out the big heavy circular saw. Most cuts made with circular saws are on materials less than 2" thick. With the Rockwell Compact Circular Saw, tackle any of these jobs with ease, comfort and control and with just one hand. The slim grip handle improves comfort while enhancing grip and control, allowing you to guide the saw with just one hand. The result? Quick, easy operation with increased maneuverability for making cut-offs, plunge cuts and rips. Ideal for wood, especially plywood, hardwood flooring, nominal 2” lumber, molding, pegboard, dowels, etc.
feature_bullets: Compact but powerful 5-amp electric motor, matching performance of full-size saws at 3,500 rpm
At only 5 pounds, is 50% lighter than conventional 7-1/4” circular saws, cuts through 2x4s in a single pass
Left-handed blade design provides remarkable cut-line visibility
Slim, inline grip design provides great comfort, balance, and control; maneuverable for overhead cuts
The saw’s maximum cutting depth at 90 degrees is 1-11/16” and its bevel capacity at 45 degrees is 1-1/8”. Arbor Size:3/8 inches

specifications.Included Components: 1 x 24 Tooth Carbide-Tipped Blade 1 x Parallel Guide 1 x Vacuum Adapter 1 x Hex Key, Rockwell 4-1/2" Compact Circular Saw
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,415 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
